--------------------------------------------------------------------------
                             Boot Camp - Clan MOTD                             
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Welcome to Boot Camp!
Be sure to register on our website http://www.aardwolfboot.com
Also join us on Discord: https://discord.gg/GCjHxxZ
and Aardwolf's Discord channel https://discord.gg/KH62U8P
Don't forget our clan skills:
mutare (double / half the weight of an item) 
napalm (str and int buff) 
Always read your notes on the Personal Board, as well as Announce and Mudinfo.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
[ End of Clan MOTD - Press Return to continue ]


Welcome to Aardwolf. May your adventures be mystical, challenging and rewarding.
CLAN: At-ten-tion! KumoGami is here to get some training done!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) Ruo the Elementalist.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.
There are 185 players on, the most on this reboot was 304.
There are 184 players using compression.

| yourself to our members and ask questions if you like. Make sure
| you have completed the academy goal.
| 
| After this period  you  will need to contact a Boot Member who is above the
| rank of Corpsman / Medic for a formal interview. Staff members will be posted
| at the bottom of this note if there are any issues. Alternatively, someone
| may contact you for an interview.
| 
| Before your interview you will need to read over the following Aardwolf help
| files:
| 
|  Help Boot
|  Help Newbieclan
|  Help Rules
|  Help Botting
| 
| After your interview you will be inducted into the clan as soon as a General
| is on and someone is available to give you a tour.
| 
| Please note that if you send a member a tell and they do not respond it is most
| likely because they are afk.
| 
| More information about us can be found in claninfo boot

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) Ruo the Elementalist.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

n
The dark cave
  Entering the dark cave, an overwhelming feeling of dread and despair fills 
your being. Smells of rotten decay waft up from below with sounds that pierce
your being and make the hairs on your neck stand on end. You wonder if this 
adventure is really worth the rewards after hearing tales in the village 
about an eight-armed skeleton who stole a woman only two days ago. Maybe it 
was just the peasant's imagination working during the excitement of the 
moment. Looking around to make sure it's safe to go down, you notice 
something scrawled on the wall.

[ Exits: south down ]

2428/2428 HP  2538/3016 MP  2087/2088 mv  448tnl  
Lv 105  G 2384266 | The dark cave (SD)
>>    
d
A rough hewn passageway of stone
  Dropping down through the hole above you, you find yourself standing in a 
twisting passageway of stone. Red eyes glowing in the darkness gleam at you 
and the shuffling sounds of something moving nearer reaches your ears.
Quickly lighting a torch you hold it up, gasping with fear as you take a step
back as undead move forward. So many of them, so many different kinds, your 
mind races... How can this be that they are all working together like this?
Your question will have to wait...

[ Exits: north east west up down ]

CLAN: At-ten-tion! Abraxos is here to get some training done!

help aq
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Area Quests'.
Help Category : Area.
Related Helps : Goals, Quest.
Last Updated  : 2017-06-20 14:20:54.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Unlike normal quests from Questor, you do not "go on" area quests; they are
simply puzzles hidden within areas.  Many of these have different rewards,
including the possibility of special equipment or a portal leading to the 
area.  With very few exceptions, area quests are isolated- everything needed 
is usually in the area with the quest.  Not all areas have an area quest, and
there's no easy way to distinguish which do and which do not until you find 
them. Many area quests have been converted into the more handy goal system 
(see 'help goals').

There are any number of things you may have to do to solve an area quest.
These usually (but not always) include interacting with a mobile in some 
fashion- giving a certain mob gold or equipment, saying something in 
particular, and/or using a social on the mob or to a room.  Clues are often
given in descriptions of rooms, objects, and mobiles, as well as through
listening to mobiles with the 'listen' command.

It is not illegal to give people hints and advice on area quests but we do
ask that you avoid just giving them the entire answer, particularly on
those puzzles that are never needed for normal quests and have special
rewards at the end.  You are encouraged to explore the areas for yourself
and solve the puzzles on your own.  If you are just plain stuck after
trying everything you can think of, feel free to see if anyone on the
question channel feels like giving out some hints.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

2428/2428 HP  2596/3016 MP  2088/2088 mv  448tnl

e
A rough hewn passageway of stone
  Finally emerging past the rows of caverns, you find yourself still traveling 
through the rough stone passageways. Curving to the east you see a light up 
ahead in what appears to be a much larger cavern. If there is light perhaps 
there is help, or at least maybe no undead to contend with. Maybe the priests
are not the only ones here trying to help.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

nails.

e
A large, lit cavern (G)
  A ladder descends through a hole in the floor here; unfortunately it is 
covered by some type of glass dome with a strange lock on it. You nearly jump
out of your boots as a deep hiss comes from a dark corner of the room. You 
leap back and ready your weapons as a sword narrowly whistles past your gut.
Trembling, you face your opponent, the eight armed skeleton that the 
villagers told you about. Its eyes glow bright red, a deep hatred of your 
life plainly visible in them. It unslings three shields and draws four more 
swords. Set to advance, you quickly realize this may very well be the end of 
your life. Your thoughts fade as it comes at you, blades whistling through 
the air...

[ Exits: east west (down) ]
(Red Aura) An insane-looking, green-skinned, bald man sits here gnawing on a bone.
(Red Aura) An eight armed skeleton stands here wielding several swords and three shields!

Before the door
  Standing before the door you can see faint traces of light coming from around
its edges, and you can just barely make out what sounds like a boiling noise 
coming from inside. Pushing against the door you find it locked. Taking a 
mighty swing with your axe results in a chipped blade. This door is protected
by some sort of powerful magic enchantment. You wonder what it will take to 
break this spell so you can find out what's going on inside...

A rough hewn passageway of stone (2085)

The dark cave
  Entering the dark cave, an overwhelming feeling of dread and despair fills 
your being. Smells of rotten decay waft up from below with sounds that pierce
your being and make the hairs on your neck stand on end. You wonder if this 
adventure is really worth the rewards after hearing tales in the village 
about an eight-armed skeleton who stole a woman only two days ago. Maybe it 
was just the peasant's imagination working during the excitement of the 
moment. Looking around to make sure it's safe to go down, you notice 
something scrawled on the wall.

[ Exits: south down ]

2428/2428 HP  2797/3016 MP  2084/2088 mv  448tnl  
Lv 105  G 2384266 | The dark cave (SD)
>>    
d
A rough hewn passageway of stone
  Dropping down through the hole above you, you find yourself standing in a 
twisting passageway of stone. Red eyes glowing in the darkness gleam at you 
and the shuffling sounds of something moving nearer reaches your ears.
Quickly lighting a torch you hold it up, gasping with fear as you take a step
back as undead move forward. So many of them, so many different kinds, your 
mind races... How can this be that they are all working together like this?
Your question will have to wait...

[ Exits: north east west up down ]
(Red Aura) A slow moving figure covered in wounds stands here.

A rough hewn passageway of stone
  Finally emerging past the rows of caverns, you find yourself still traveling 
through the rough stone passageways. Curving to the east you see a light up 
ahead in what appears to be a much larger cavern. If there is light perhaps 
there is help, or at least maybe no undead to contend with. Maybe the priests
are not the only ones here trying to help.

e
A large, lit cavern (G)
  A ladder descends through a hole in the floor here; unfortunately it is 
covered by some type of glass dome with a strange lock on it. You nearly jump
out of your boots as a deep hiss comes from a dark corner of the room. You 
leap back and ready your weapons as a sword narrowly whistles past your gut.
Trembling, you face your opponent, the eight armed skeleton that the 
villagers told you about. Its eyes glow bright red, a deep hatred of your 
life plainly visible in them. It unslings three shields and draws four more 
swords. Set to advance, you quickly realize this may very well be the end of 
your life. Your thoughts fade as it comes at you, blades whistling through 
the air...

[ Exits: east west (down) ]
(Hidden) (Translucent) (Red Aura) A nasty-looking grey-skinned man stands here with filth-encrusted
nails.
(Red Aura) An insane-looking, green-skinned, bald man sits here gnawing on a bone.
(Red Aura) An eight armed skeleton stands here wielding several swords and three shields!

A large, lit cavern (G)
  A ladder descends through a hole in the floor here; unfortunately it is 
covered by some type of glass dome with a strange lock on it. You nearly jump
out of your boots as a deep hiss comes from a dark corner of the room. You 
leap back and ready your weapons as a sword narrowly whistles past your gut.
Trembling, you face your opponent, the eight armed skeleton that the 
villagers told you about. Its eyes glow bright red, a deep hatred of your 
life plainly visible in them. It unslings three shields and draws four more 
swords. Set to advance, you quickly realize this may very well be the end of 
your life. Your thoughts fade as it comes at you, blades whistling through 
the air...

A rough hewn passageway of stone (2082)

A cavern
  This cavern seems to be some sort of refuse dump for body parts and personal 
belongings. Apparently there must be someone else around here to use this 
cavern as a waste room; certainly the undead would not care about such 
things. As you wonder about this discovery you sense some movement coming 
from the heaps of rotting flesh and clothing. Bracing yourself, you watch 
cautiously for the source. Suddenly you are showered by clumps of rot as a 
huge bulbous creature emerges, waving two tentacled arms about. It gnashes 
its teeth in a grotesque central maw as its single eye darts back and forth 
seemingly to keep you in its field of vision.

A cavern
  Running into the room, you see a band of elven warriors standing together in 
a tight formation. Shields and swords drawn, they are facing a huge beast.
It appears to be some form of bear, but it has to be undead. Its ribcage

pieces of it seem to have just fallen off. The elves are obviously 
well-trained, and they move forward in unison attacking the beast 
ferociously, hacking lumps of flesh from its body. It roars in frustration 
and, seemingly unaffected, it charges!

A large, lit cavern (G)
  A ladder descends through a hole in the floor here; unfortunately it is 
covered by some type of glass dome with a strange lock on it. You nearly jump
out of your boots as a deep hiss comes from a dark corner of the room. You 
leap back and ready your weapons as a sword narrowly whistles past your gut.
Trembling, you face your opponent, the eight armed skeleton that the 
villagers told you about. Its eyes glow bright red, a deep hatred of your 
life plainly visible in them. It unslings three shields and draws four more 
swords. Set to advance, you quickly realize this may very well be the end of 
your life. Your thoughts fade as it comes at you, blades whistling through 
the air...

>>    The temple entry (G)
  Climbing down the ladder, you are amazed to find that you are in an actual 
section that has been carved out. Torches line the smooth stone walls and 
give off a friendly light making you feel more at ease. That is, until the 
chanting starts. Stepping up to the door, you press your ear against the cool
wood and listen intently. Several voices are coming from somewhere ahead; 
they are very faint. If this room were not so quiet, you really doubt you 
would have noticed them at all. Taking advantage of not being discovered yet,
you stop to look around. A strange symbol decorates the east wall.

[ Exits: (north) up ]

2428/2428 HP  3016/3016 MP  2084/2088 mv  438tnl  
Lv 105  G 2394313 | The temple entry ([N]U)
>>    


l;ex
The temple entry (G)
  Climbing down the ladder, you are amazed to find that you are in an actual 
section that has been carved out. Torches line the smooth stone walls and 
give off a friendly light making you feel more at ease. That is, until the 
chanting starts. Stepping up to the door, you press your ear against the cool
wood and listen intently. Several voices are coming from somewhere ahead; 
they are very faint. If this room were not so quiet, you really doubt you 
would have noticed them at all. Taking advantage of not being discovered yet,
you stop to look around. A strange symbol decorates the east wall.

Lepdar (Recruit) tells the CLAN: 'when someone sends a note to boot we all get it'

Altar of sacrifice
  Drawing closer, you see that there is no table here but in fact a bloody 
altar. Several men stand around the altar chanting over the body of a young 
woman who is chained down to it. Holding hands with their eyes closed they 
don't seem to notice you walk up. You can see that their skin is gray and has
a leathery look to it. These are not men- they are undead performing some 
dark ritual! Suddenly the chanting rises in volume until it becomes almost a 
yell. The man in the center, at the head of the altar, suddenly steps forward
and drives his hand into the young woman's chest! The still living girl lets 
out a low moan. As her last breath escapes her, the evil priest pulls her 
still-beating heart out and holds it high. Suddenly seeing you, he screams in
rage, "Kill this fool! No mortal will ever witness such a ceremony and escape
to tell about it!" The undead priests turn on you as he flees north.

[ Exits: north (east) south ]

help warmth
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : WARMTH.
Help Category : Protection.
Related Helps : Holy Mirror, Toxic Resistance.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-31 22:24:43.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: cast 'warmth' <target>
Spell Number: 253

This spell gives its target resistance to cold-based attacks such as 
chill touch, ice cloud, ice storm and any weapons with "cold" damage
types.

Primary stat: Constitution and Wisdom
Affected by : Luck


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

A dim hallway

there is no sign of him now. Doors lie to the west and north.

[ Exits: (north) south (west) ]

2330/2462 HP  2044/3046 MP  2109/2109 mv  856tnl  
Lv 106  G 2430198 | A dim hallway ([N]S[W])
>>    
s
Altar of sacrifice
  Drawing closer, you see that there is no table here but in fact a bloody 
altar. Several men stand around the altar chanting over the body of a young 
woman who is chained down to it. Holding hands with their eyes closed they 
don't seem to notice you walk up. You can see that their skin is gray and has
a leathery look to it. These are not men- they are undead performing some 
dark ritual! Suddenly the chanting rises in volume until it becomes almost a 
yell. The man in the center, at the head of the altar, suddenly steps forward
and drives his hand into the young woman's chest! The still living girl lets 
out a low moan. As her last breath escapes her, the evil priest pulls her 
still-beating heart out and holds it high. Suddenly seeing you, he screams in
rage, "Kill this fool! No mortal will ever witness such a ceremony and escape
to tell about it!" The undead priests turn on you as he flees north.

[ Exits: north (east) south ]
     (Magic) A bloody golden altar rests in this room.
(Golden Aura) A woman lies naked on an altar here, tied down and badly beaten.
(Red Aura) An undead priest wearing a short robe chants some unknown words.
(Invis) (Red Aura) An undead priest dressed in long, flowing black robes stands here praying.
(Red Aura) An undead priest wearing a short robe chants some unknown words.

2330/2462 HP  2044/3046 MP  2109/2109 mv  856tnl  
Lv 106  G 2430198 | Altar of sacrifice (N[E]S)
s
>>    
Staging area
  This room is huge. It stretches northwards, and you can see several figures 
huddled around what appears to be a table. Bloody barred cells line the east 
wall and there is another wooden door to the west. Dozens of corpses lie 
about this room in various stages. Some are only skeletal, others appear to 
be in various stages of decomposition, while a few appear to have a drained 
look. Odd that they are just lying about stacked like this. Perhaps they are 
just waiting to be enchanted with the force that will give them undead 
life...

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Red Aura) An unfinished, undead creation rises up from the floor seeking a soul.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Hidden) (Translucent) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Lepdar is here.
(Player) (Invis) (Hidden) (White Aura) Nueve The Bod is resting here.
(Player) (Invis) (Hidden) (Translucent) (White Aura) Talbor the Enchanter.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Shallow Water
  The water is so clear that the bottom can easily be seen.  Some small
seaweed is growing here, letting the waves guide its movement.  The sand is
very fine; not a single rock can be found here.  Water stretches in every
direction but north, where the beach of the island lies.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Golden Aura) A small girl is playing in the water.
(Red Aura) A young boy is splashing water everywhere.
(Golden Aura) A small girl is playing in the water.

Sun Warmed Beach
  The sand of the sun-warmed beach has footprints that lead in various
directions.  Some of the footprints have been filled with water, some washed
away by the waves.  Various sea shells adorn the sand as if they were placed
there by magic, when in reality, the waves left behind some small treasures
for children to find.  The view of the ocean to the south and west is
breathtakingly beautiful.  The salty sea air is filled with the sound of
hungry seagulls and laughing children.  

[ Exits: north east south ]

>>    *[NOEXP]* The Sand Castle
  A large sand castle has been built along the edge of the ocean.  A deep
moat has been placed around it to help protect it from the waves.  The
castle stands about three feet tall and has a roof adorned with beautiful
sea shells.  Although the moat is full and the waves are beginning to lap
against the castle's walls, the castle stands sturdily against the rising
tide.

>>    *[NOEXP]* The Pier (G)
  The pier is where many people come to fish.  It extends quite a way into
the water, making fishing for large fish easier.  It has some loose boards
here and there and some spots are in need of repair badly.  A large sign has
been posted on part of the pier, but most people ignore it.  The sun beats
down upon the pier making it a good spot to sunbathe and relax.  Many people
walk along the large pier daily.

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
w
The Embankment
  The beach gives way to a large embankment to the north.  A small path has
been made up the embankment into the island's shopping center.  The
embankment was made when the island was purchased from Ivar Industries to
keep the high tides from destroying the developments of the island.  The
embankment is made of mostly clay and rock and has withstood through many bad
storms.  The embankment was built around the whole island, leaving very
little of the beach accessible.  

[ Exits: north east south ]

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
Trade Boulevard
  The embankment rises to a dozen feet above the sea level.  A wide path
leads south to the beach, while the road is paved at the top of the
embankment leading north to the various shops of the island.  The road is
very clean as it gets swept every day.  To the west is a large shoe store,
and to the east is the back entrance to Rusty's Bar.  

[ Exits: north (east) south (west) ]

>>    *[NOEXP]* Trade Boulevard
  The road would be in perfect condition was it not that one of the stones
is missing on the eastern side.  The hole it left is about the size of a
fist.  For the rest the road is perfectly straight and even.  Whoever laid
this road did a very good job.  Aiden's Weapon Shop has been painted on the

east is the back of Rusty's Bar.  A large mural has been painted on the
entire wall.

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
Aimie's Floral Shop
  The aroma of fresh cut flowers fills the small eccentric botanical
establishment.  Plants of all sizes and beautiful floral arrangements cover
most of the floor space, leaving little room to walk.  A small counter with
a cash register stands near the back of the room awaiting daily sales.  A
small sign is posted at the counter.

     (Polished) An axe, made of bones from a defeated dragon, lies here.

Aimie the florist looks up from her flower arrangement and says, 'Welcome to my flower shop, feel
free to look around. If I can help you in any way, please let me know.'

>>    *[NOEXP]* Royalty Row
  Trade Boulevard ends here, and Royalty Row begins.  This road leads up

and a few park benches have been placed along the road for weary
travelers.

  The hill isn't very steep at all, yet it gradually inclines to the

south.  To the north, between the trees, is a bench for travelers to rest. 
The tulips are orange to the north, and to the south they are a deep purple.
Royalty Row continues east and west as far as the eye can see.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Rusty's Bar
  A large wooden bar stands near the west wall.  As customers enter they
are greeted by the bartender who tirelessly mixes them a drink and talks
about the many rumors, adventures, and the likes of the islanders.  The
smell of liquor is almost overwhelming at times, but no one ever complains. 
Music from the live band and the fighting at the back of the establishment
can be heard very well here.  

[ Exits: east south ]

>>    *[NOEXP]* The Embankment
  The beach gives way to a large embankment to the north.  A small path has
been made up the embankment into the island's shopping center.  The
embankment was made when the island was purchased from Ivar Industries to
keep the high tides from destroying the developments of the island.  The
embankment is made of mostly clay and rock and has withstood through many bad
storms.  The embankment was built around the whole island, leaving very
little of the beach accessible.

>>    *[NOEXP]* The Pier (G)
  The pier is where many people come to fish.  It extends quite a way into
the water, making fishing for large fish easier.  It has some loose boards
here and there and some spots are in need of repair badly.  A large sign has
been posted on part of the pier, but most people ignore it.  The sun beats
down upon the pier making it a good spot to sunbathe and relax.  Many people
walk along the large pier daily.

The Rock On The Beach
  A big black rock lies on the sand here.  It is very smooth, not a single
sharp edge can be found.  The top is flat, sloping slightly.  It is large
enough for several children to lie down on.  The sand around it is very fine
and soft.  Seashells are scattered about, unfortunately most are broken.

>>    *[NOEXP]* The Embankment
  The beach gives way to a large embankment to the north.  A small path has
been made up the embankment into the island's shopping center.  The
embankment was made when the island was purchased from Ivar Industries to
keep the high tides from destroying the developments of the island.  The
embankment is made of mostly clay and rock and has withstood through many bad
storms.  The embankment was built around the whole island, leaving very
little of the beach accessible.

Infirmary (G)
  Oh no it looks like the perils of Aardwolf have overcome you and you have 
fallen in battle. No worries though it looks like your fellow soldiers were 
able to recover your body and resurrect your spirit. It's a strange feeling 
seeing your body on the ground. IMPORTANT: Make sure you loot everything 
off your corpse and it decomposes before you leave the room! Sometimes
you might have issues seeing the invisible objects on your corpse. You can 
buy a detect invisibility potion from our shop run s3e from here and type 
list. Also don't be afraid to ask for a miracle on clantalk. If it works 
it could help restore some of your lost experience. The Medical Lounge is 
south from here in case you need a healer.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

e
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Invis) (Hidden) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Nueve The Bod is resting here.
(Player) (Invis) (Hidden) (Translucent) (White Aura) Talbor the Enchanter.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Shallow Water
  The water is so clear that the bottom can easily be seen.  Some small
seaweed is growing here, letting the waves guide its movement.  The sand is
very fine; not a single rock can be found here.  Water stretches in every
direction but north, where the beach of the island lies.

  Trade Boulevard ends here, and Royalty Row begins.  This road leads up
a large hill to an elaborate mansion that overlooks the entire island. 
Tall trees grow along the side of the road, and tulips of all colors
circle each tree along this road.  Plush grass grows in between the trees
and a few park benches have been placed along the road for weary
travelers.

Royalty Row
  The hill isn't very steep at all, yet it gradually inclines to the
highest point on the island.  The row of trees continues to the north and
south.  To the north, between the trees, is a bench for travelers to rest. 
The tulips are orange to the north, and to the south they are a deep purple.
Royalty Row continues east and west as far as the eye can see.

Royalty Row
  The hill isn't very steep at all, yet it gradually inclines to the
highest point on the island.  The row of trees continues to the north and
south.  To the north, between the trees, is a bench for travelers to rest.

Royalty Row continues east and west as far as the eye can see.

Royalty Row
  Trade Boulevard ends here, and Royalty Row begins.  This road leads up
a large hill to an elaborate mansion that overlooks the entire island. 
Tall trees grow along the side of the road, and tulips of all colors
circle each tree along this road.  Plush grass grows in between the trees
and a few park benches have been placed along the road for weary
travelers.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Invis) (Hidden) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Nueve The Bod is resting here.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Shallow Water
  The water is so clear that the bottom can easily be seen.  Some small
seaweed is growing here, letting the waves guide its movement.  The sand is
very fine; not a single rock can be found here.  Water stretches in every
direction but north, where the beach of the island lies.

The Rock On The Beach
  A big black rock lies on the sand here.  It is very smooth, not a single
sharp edge can be found.  The top is flat, sloping slightly.  It is large
enough for several children to lie down on.  The sand around it is very fine
and soft.  Seashells are scattered about, unfortunately most are broken.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Shallow Water
  The water is so clear that the bottom can easily be seen.  Some small
seaweed is growing here, letting the waves guide its movement.  The sand is
very fine; not a single rock can be found here.  Water stretches in every
direction but north, where the beach of the island lies.

Lv 106  G 2464662 | Shallow Water (NESW)

n
The Sand Castle
  A large sand castle has been built along the edge of the ocean.  A deep
moat has been placed around it to help protect it from the waves.  The
castle stands about three feet tall and has a roof adorned with beautiful
sea shells.  Although the moat is full and the waves are beginning to lap
against the castle's walls, the castle stands sturdily against the rising
tide.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
     (Glow) (Hum) A small pail contains saltwater.
     (Magic) The sand has been made into a small mound.
(Red Aura) The seagull flies through the air eyeing the other seagulls on the ground.
(Golden Aura) A man with a fishing pole is looking for the perfect fishing spot.
(Red Aura) A small boy is building a sand castle.
(Golden Aura) The little girl is showing off her seashells.

The Beach (2107)

A Grove Of Palm Trees (2105)

The Rock On The Beach
  A big black rock lies on the sand here.  It is very smooth, not a single
sharp edge can be found.  The top is flat, sloping slightly.  It is large
enough for several children to lie down on.  The sand around it is very fine
and soft.  Seashells are scattered about, unfortunately most are broken.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
( 2) (Glow) (Hum) A small pail contains saltwater.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Invis) (Hidden) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Nueve The Bod is resting here.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Ascension Bluff (2064)

A Somber Walkway (G)
  After ascending a stairway of clouds leading into the heavens, an individual 
would probably expect to find something surreal at the top. Many an explorer 
has been left disappointed, however, since this is nothing more than the 
Ascension Bluff Nursing Home. The architect thought that a stairway of clouds
would make the residents feel closer to the gods. Unfortunately, all this 
served to do was make this location less suitable for visitors and employees 
to frequent. Further to this, when one closely inspects the clouds, they will
come to the realization that they are not real clouds at all, but rather 
millions of tiny cotton balls affixed to a steel frame. Interestingly enough,
it seems that a nursing home in the clouds acquires quite the eclectic bunch 
of residents. Anyone who chances by a for a visit will find that this nursing
home contains more than just your ordinary sampling of senior citizens.

[ Exits: north down ]
A witch is here, snooping around for spell components.

A Somber Walkway (2060)

A Somber Walkway (2060)

Entrance to Ascension Bluff
  At the entrance to the Ascension Bluff Nursing home the pathway widens into a
semi-circle of flagstones that are surrounded by several stout wooden 
benches. A low-set stone wall hugs all of these particulars, and three wide, 
curved steps lead up to the front entrance of the nursing home. This nursing 
home has been made to look like a lodge in hopes that the residents will feel
like they are simply here on vacation. The roof has a steep slope and the 
exterior of the building has been carefully crafted from wooden logs. Patio 
doors lead straight out to the front gardens and walkway from many locations 
along the front of the building. Even more light is brought into the nursing 
home via expansive, arched windows that take up much of the wall-space above
the patio doors.

[ Exits: (north) south ]
     (Magic) A stout wooden bench is here to relax on.
A witch is here, snooping around for spell components.

The Reception Area (2059)

It looks like a maintenance worker is packing up for the day.
The Reception Area
  In this section of the nursing home, a reception desk has been built to stand
along the northern wall. In order to save some gold, the nursing home 
acquires volunteers to work at this reception desk. Calming music drifts 
forth here from some indiscernible source. It seems to be an unfamiliar 
lullaby that repeats itself in a loop. Now, that might get a tad bit annoying
for an individual who happens to spend a lot of time at this desk, but then 
again, maybe anyone working here would just tune it out after a while. The 
mural painted behind this desk shows an image of trees stretching out their 
branches in order to hold each other. Some sort of high-tech magical visual 
device has been installed near the ceiling in this corner of the room, 
seemingly to scan the entryway for unwanted guests.

[ Exits: east south (west) ]
     (Magic) Here is a reception desk. A bell to ring sits on its ledge.

The Reception Area (2057)

The Reception Area
  The architectural team for this nursing home pondered the fact that in the 
beginning, these types of facilities started out as extensions to hospitals.
Therefore, to a certain extent, folks expect that a nursing home will retain 
that appearance. The team also recognized that the building's entrance is 
incredibly important in giving visitors that positive first impression of 
what the overall facility will be like. So the designer team worked hard to 
create a spacious, colorful, and inviting entrance. They wanted to imbue an 
overwhelming feeling of happiness within the individual as they took their 
first steps into the building. To do this, they utilized a palette of warm 
color tones for several large wall murals, as well as floors crafted with a 
tile mosaic finish. They added comfortable furniture to relax in, and spared 
no expense on an extravagant, cathedral ceiling, made perfect with the 
addition of incredible skylights.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
     (Magic) This small sign is discreet, yet impossible to miss.
     (Magic) Brightly colored armchairs have been scattered throughout this area.
(Red Aura) This doctor must have woken up on the wrong side of the bed.
(Red Aura) Someone has carelessly tossed a handkerchief onto the ground here.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

whine.

A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Vast Corridor (2069)

Before the entrance to the Underdark
  You stand before a huge door.  The corridor can easily fit fifteen humans
standing side by side here.  The floor has levelled off and has been worn
smooth by the dragging feet of the slave flocks.  You stand just before the
Underdark.  The Underdark is a huge city that rivals its surface
counterpart, Aylor.  From what you have heard, anything goes in the
Underdark.  A dangerous place at best, only those who have had at least ten
levels of experience should venture into it.  On the wall to the north are a
series of markings that you can't make out at this distance.  A huge door
stands to the west, the way to the surface is up.

Traveller's Crescent (2097)

Traveller's Crescent
  You stand at the west side of the city along Traveller's Crescent.  You have
heard rumours that githzerai have been seen walking around this part of
the road.  Glowing orbs in the air light the area around you.  The orbs seem
to be flickering on and off.  Screams reach your ears here, the screams of
slaves being whipped.  The smell of sweat and perspiration is sickly sweet
to your nose, and tangy to your taste.
 
Traveller's Crescent goes east and south.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Nueve The Bod is resting here.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Into the dark (G)
  You have entered a room of nothingness; there is no sound, no breeze, no
sign of life whatsoever, just a large dark hole.  This hole is said to lead
to a world of eternal darkness that is sure to drive you mad if you wander
through it for too long.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1833/2462 HP  1899/3046 MP  2072/2109 mv  698tnl  
Lv 106  G 2511834 | Into the dark (NESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* Walk of the Stars - Umbra
  This shadowy path, no doubt created by some dark force, seems even darker
than the cold emptiness of space.  The shadows form a loop, almost like a
leash around the stars, encircling Jabbah entirely while stretching out east
to Novus Ordo, back west around Polaris, and south, just shy of Xathanc,
before completing the loop.  Polaris is just west of here, while Jabbah is
off to the southeast.  Azah and Tyl can be seen together in the northwest,
across the Fundamental Celestial Plane.

The Desolate Pridelands
  The rocky features of the pridelands begin to blur and shift in the eyes
of weary wanderers.  An endless expanse, it seems to stretch into death
itself.  Animal skulls are common.  Cracked, and worn by the harsh winds
that pass through this area, they take on macabre and menacing countenances.

in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Into the dark (G)
  You have entered a room of nothingness; there is no sound, no breeze, no
sign of life whatsoever, just a large dark hole.  This hole is said to lead
to a world of eternal darkness that is sure to drive you mad if you wander
through it for too long.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Nueve The Bod is resting here.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

thick, soothing to weary feet.  Once, perfect nature murals covered the
walls, but now they are singed in spots and their beauty is marred.  Flowers
are dotted about the room, preserved by the unconquerable magic deep within
the foundations...

A... pond?! (2109)

Murky Water (2107)

A Small Underground Stream
  The stream here is a tunnel, the rock sides rugged and close.  The roof
is getting lower, too, though it is dotted with air pockets and shallow,
natural caves.  Kelp and streamweed grow closely together in the streambed,
and bunches of eggs hide among them.  Schools of minnows practice swimming
down and upstream, learning to use their tails and fins like their parents. 
Apparently, continuing downstream will eventually take you to a river.  

[ Exits: south west other ]
( 3) (Magic) A smoked fishsteak tempts you with its delicious fragrance.
     A frond of kelp waves gently in the current.
(Red Aura) A quick little minnow dodges about between the fronds of kelp and streamweed.
(Golden Aura) A herring is swimming about, trying not to get caught.

>>    *[NOEXP]* An Enormous Cavern
  Apart from the torches on the walls, this cave would be dark and lonely. 
Even the flickering light of the torches is barely enough to see; darkness
remains, cowering in hollows and corners, hiding from the light.  This
immense cavern seems to be completely natural, having no signs of carving or
any other irregular abrasions.  The high roof seems to close in to the
north, gradually becoming more of a tunnel - though at its lowest, a
nicely-grown centaur could still stand comfortably without touching...  If
ever a centaur would venture down into this darkness.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Palaestra
  Gold and silver accents are all around, adding to the splendor of the
main room.  The flames, from the gold lanterns hanging from the walls,
flicker in the breeze from the atrium.  There is even a marble fountain
towards the back of the room.  The slaves move quickly about, making sure
everything is in perfect order.

Palaestra Atrium
  As you enter the Provincial Governor's Palaestra, the guards close the
large double doors behind you.  You notice the beautiful murals covering the
walls from the ceiling down to the white marble floor.  There are several
windows open, allowing a cool breeze to blow through the atrium, stirring
the wind chimes to song.

agonizing or ferocious look about them, fill the room: a tiger is reared up
on his hind legs looking to strike its foe with an outstretched paw; several
lions are poised to attack; and many other animals, the likes of which you
have never seen, are spread throughout.

agonizing or ferocious look about them, fill the room: a tiger is reared up
on his hind legs looking to strike its foe with an outstretched paw; several
lions are poised to attack; and many other animals, the likes of which you
have never seen, are spread throughout.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Sarno Road
  This portion of the road is especially well adorned.  The oil lanterns
around the doorways are made of gold, and intricate murals decorate the
walls.  To the south, gold-laden double doors are guarded to prevent easy
entry into the Governor's Palaestra.  People, awaiting the next theatre
performance, gather around the entrance to the north.

Cardo Maximus (2108)

Sarno Road
  This portion of the road is especially well adorned.  The oil lanterns
around the doorways are made of gold, and intricate murals decorate the
walls.  To the south, gold-laden double doors are guarded to prevent easy
entry into the Governor's Palaestra.  People, awaiting the next theatre
performance, gather around the entrance to the north.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Theatre (2106)

Actors' Guild
  Two actors stand in the center of the room practicing their lines,
making grand motions to emphasize their words, and arguing over how a piece
should be played.  Grumbling to himself, a man searches through wardrobes
for something to wear during his next performance.  Behind the scenes is far
less attractive than the finished product; maybe it's time to go back to the
theatre.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

85/2462 HP  1572/3046 MP  2108/2109 mv  854tnl  
Lv 106  G 2598911 | Medical lounge (ED)
>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

e
Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Infirmary (G)
  Oh no it looks like the perils of Aardwolf have overcome you and you have 
fallen in battle. No worries though it looks like your fellow soldiers were 
able to recover your body and resurrect your spirit. It's a strange feeling 
seeing your body on the ground. IMPORTANT: Make sure you loot everything 
off your corpse and it decomposes before you leave the room! Sometimes
you might have issues seeing the invisible objects on your corpse. You can 
buy a detect invisibility potion from our shop run s3e from here and type 
list. Also don't be afraid to ask for a miracle on clantalk. If it works 
it could help restore some of your lost experience. The Medical Lounge is 
south from here in case you need a healer.

sell all
Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

>>    *[NOEXP]* 


Courtyard (G)
  It stinks.  The smell of sweat, tears and broken spirits fills the air.
The sounds of soldiers in training have gotten much louder as you step
into the courtyard. "I don't know but I've been told, it's hard to run
with the weight of gold." You see soldiers everywhere running laps on
a beaten path around the courtyard. Some less-fortunate soldiers are lined
up doing pushups in the mud. In the center of the courtyard lay a finely 
manicured lawn and the Boot clan flag. To the north you notice the bunk 
house, to the west the General's quarters. Suddenly, an officer grabs you 
by the shoulder and shouts "What are you gawking around for, future
soldier? It's time you enlisted!" And with that he points you east to 
the enlisting office.

[ Exits: north east ]

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Cardo Maximus
  As you enter the city gates, you notice some of the beauty and luxury
Pompeii offers.  Under your feet, the street is paved with smooth limestone,
and elaborately constructed buildings are all around.  To the west, you see
a sign on a door.  To the north, the city waits to be explored.  Bronze
oil lanterns in each doorway light the street and allow the spectacular
murals on the walls to be seen.

Sarno Road
  This portion of the road is especially well adorned.  The oil lanterns
around the doorways are made of gold, and intricate murals decorate the
walls.  To the south, gold-laden double doors are guarded to prevent easy
entry into the Governor's Palaestra.  People, awaiting the next theatre
performance, gather around the entrance to the north.

Actors' Guild
  Two actors stand in the center of the room practicing their lines,
making grand motions to emphasize their words, and arguing over how a piece
should be played.  Grumbling to himself, a man searches through wardrobes
for something to wear during his next performance.  Behind the scenes is far
less attractive than the finished product; maybe it's time to go back to the
theatre.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) (OPK) Tench the Venomist.
(Player) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Nueve The Bod is resting here.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

The Statue of Zeus
  On his head is a sculpted wreath of olive sprays, in his right hand he
holds a figure of Victory made from ivory and gold...  In his left hand, he
holds a sceptre inlaid with every kind of metal, with an eagle perched on
the sceptre.  His sandals are made of gold, as is his robe.  His garments
are carved with the animals and with lilies.  The throne is decorated with
gold, precious stones, ebony, and ivory.

n
Exhibit of Zeus
  You enter a large room with high marble walls.  Beautiful carvings are
engraved in every corner of the room.  In the center of the room stands an
enormous statue bearing the likeness of Zeus.  At the base of the statue is
a bronze plaque that reads: 
 
Wonder Fact: 
In ancient times, the Greeks held one of their most important festivals 
in honor of Zeus.  The Olympic Games started in 776 BC, and were held on 
the western continent of Greece in a region called Peloponnesus.  

[ Exits: north south ]
     (Magic) A pair of green sleeves lie here.
     A pair of boots lie here.
     You see a chest plate, made of worn leather, on the floor.
     A battered shield, made of heavy steel, is dropped on the ground.
     A sceptre befitting a king, befitting a god even, lies here.
     The half of a lollipop atop a grubby stick awaits to be licked.
(Red Aura) A bored upperclass student ambles by.

Great Pyramids of Giza
  You see before you a great stone structure, approximately 481 feet in
height.  Surrounded by corridors and shafts no matter which way you turn,
you must decide which way to go to reach the center.  This appears to be
more dangerous than your typical tour.  But then you knew this was not going
to be one anyway.

Base of the Pyramid
  You stand in front of the great pyramid.  The base spans 751 feet.  You
imagine how the workers managed to place around two million blocks of stone
481 feet high without the use of powerful cranes.

Great Pyramids of Giza
  You see before you a great stone structure, approximately 481 feet in
height.  Surrounded by corridors and shafts no matter which way you turn,
you must decide which way to go to reach the center.  This appears to be
more dangerous than your typical tour.  But then you knew this was not going
to be one anyway.  

[ Exits: north south ]

2257/2462 HP  2770/3046 MP  2109/2109 mv  864tnl  
Lv 106  G 2625521 | Great Pyramids of Giza (NS)
>>    *[NOEXP]*

Sarayu questions 'Thanks guys. My plan is to invest in quest items after I remort (I think that is

Museum of Wonders
  You enter into a museum unlike any other, as you are literally swept away
with the realism of your surroundings.  Your eyes begin to glaze over and
you have to fight to regain your bearings.  This is not real and these
places no longer exist.  These are merely replicas...  Or are they?  

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
A perky hostess walks around, eager to assist.
A helpful hostess says, "Welcome to the Museum of Wonders."

Hanging Gardens of Babylon
  You stand on lush green foliage as high and wide as the eye can see.  The
assault of growth is almost overwhelming.  You read on a side wall, almost
covered by flowing vines, that the Hanging Gardens were built in around 605
B.C. by King Nebuchadnezzar to cheer up his wife Amyitis who was very
homesick.

The Garden
  Vaulted terraces are raised one above the other.  This is not only an
architectural wonder, but also a biological wonder.  Plants, aviary, insects,
and anything else you could imagine to see is here.  You are filled with awe
at the work it must have entailed to replicate this.  At the end, this -is-
a replica...  Or is it?

Bay Window
  You look out a huge bay window, expecting to get a view of the busy streets 
below.  You are in a museum, after all; a museum set on one of the busiest
streets in the world.
 
The view astounds you as you find you're not looking at a street filled
with traffic, wood and coal smoke, and pedestrians. You see a large body of water, which
shouldn't be there. Looking more closely, it appears to be the Euphrates River.

The Lighthouse of Alexandria
  You are awestruck as you stand before the lighthouse.  Images of passing

Room of Facts
  You stand in a room like many of the other and you see comfortable benches
placed along the many placard stands.  Your head is spinning as you try to
decide whether you want to prop up your feet and rest, or attempt to absorb
even more facts.  Your weary mind resists the latter, as this has been a day
like no other from the second you entered the museum, which is like no
other.  
 
*The Lighthouse is located in the country of Egypt. 
*The Lighthouse stands on the island of Pharaohs. 
*The Lighthouse stood over 400 feet tall. 
*There were six wonders to disappear and the Lighthouse was one of them. 
*It is the seventh wonder added to the list. 
*The lighthouse helped ships up to 25 miles away. 

[ Exits: west ]

s
The Colossus of Rhodes
  You stand before the Colossus, a giant bronze statue. Your eyes are 
attracted to an inscription, which is attached to it.
     
To you, O Sun, the people of Dorian Rhodes set up this bronze statue
reaching to Olympus when they had pacified the waves of war and crowned
their city with the spoils taken from the enemy.  Not only over the seas but
also on land did they kindle the lovely torch of freedom. 
     
*Dedicatory inscription of the Colossus*
     
You read these words and you feel a shiver as you are struck by the power
they possess.

u
Room of Facts
  This is yet another room, filled with benches and placards.  You decide
by this time that the benches are not for the weary of body, but for the
weary of mind.  With so many facts and so much strangeness, your eyes burn
as words blur before you.  You question your sanity as you recap what you
have experienced within this day.  Resignedly you plop down on a velvet
cushioned bench, trying not to read yet another exhibit fact.  
 
*It took 12 years to build the Colossus.
*A violent earthquake brought the Colossus down. 
*It lasted under 100 years.
*The Colossus had 12.5 Tons of Bronze. 
*The Colossus was over 110 feet tall. 
*The Colossus of Rhodes looked a lot like the statue of Liberty. 
*In 357 B.C. the island of Rhodes was conquered by Mausolus
 of Halicarnassus.

[ Exits: north east west down ]

Information Booth
  The Museum of Wonders is a very large place.  It is extremely easy to get
lost or separated from your group if you're unable to find your way back to
an exit on your own.  Maybe you just want to get away from the crowds and
clear your head.  This is the only room in the whole building you know is
real, as you know exactly where you are.  

[ Exits: south down ]

     The Mausoleum at Halicarnassus
     The Colossus of Rhodes

The Statue of Zeus
  On his head is a sculpted wreath of olive sprays, in his right hand he
holds a figure of Victory made from ivory and gold...  In his left hand, he
holds a sceptre inlaid with every kind of metal, with an eagle perched on
the sceptre.  His sandals are made of gold, as is his robe.  His garments
are carved with the animals and with lilies.  The throne is decorated with
gold, precious stones, ebony, and ivory.

Exhibit of Zeus
  You enter a large room with high marble walls.  Beautiful carvings are
engraved in every corner of the room.  In the center of the room stands an
enormous statue bearing the likeness of Zeus.  At the base of the statue is
a bronze plaque that reads: 
 
Wonder Fact: 
In ancient times, the Greeks held one of their most important festivals 
in honor of Zeus.  The Olympic Games started in 776 BC, and were held on 
the western continent of Greece in a region called Peloponnesus.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Room of Facts
  You walk into a large room with placards placed along the walls.  You see
etchings, a case filled with small bits of stone, miniature statues.  You
walk up closer and read one of the placards.  Wonder Fact: In Greek
mythology Zeus was the god of the sky.  He was the rain god, a cloud
gatherer.  He wields a mighty thunderbolt.  He is represented as the god of
justice and mercy, protector of the weak, punisher of the evil.  He was
married to Hera who was also his sister and was father to many children. 
His son Ares was god of war, Hebe the goddess of youth, Hephaestus the god
of fire, and Eilethyia the goddess of childbirth.

>>    *[NOEXP]* WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) (OPK) Tench the Venomist.
(Player) (Golden Aura) Ruo the Elementalist.
(Player) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Nueve The Bod is resting here.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

energy pushing out from the opening.  You also see a sign hammered into the
ground in front of the crack, perhaps you should read it.

u
Out of the tunnels
  As you look around, you wonder if this is any better then the tunnels. 
The ground is twisted and broken, a plain filled with death.  Bones litter
the surface, hundreds of creatures must've died here.  The sky fills you
with unease as it casts an eerie array of colors around you.  You decide to
keep your eyes down since watching the clouds above you boil fills you with
nausea.
