At the foot of the mountains
  Monstrous black mountains rise before you, reaching through the clouds
above.  Lightning flashes from deep within the clouds, and peals of thunder
threaten to rattle your teeth out of your jaw.  Through the thunder you
think you can hear other sounds, furious roars and blood curdling shrieks. 
You can see a path of sorts leading up the mountain to the west.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

u
Out of the tunnels
  As you look around, you wonder if this is any better then the tunnels. 
The ground is twisted and broken, a plain filled with death.  Bones litter
the surface, hundreds of creatures must've died here.  The sky fills you
with unease as it casts an eerie array of colors around you.  You decide to
keep your eyes down since watching the clouds above you boil fills you with
nausea.

>>    *[NOEXP]* WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (White Aura) Nueve The Bod is resting here.
(Player) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) (OPK) Tench the Venomist.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.

this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

Reyn answers 'conventional wisdom - despite some noisy objectors - is that you should save QP until
level 1 of your first remort and then buy some choice aard items at level 1. you'll be able to use 
those for a very, very long time, making them efficient purchases with limited QP'

You notice the grey moon falling to the west.

Reyn answers 'and as a bonus, if you decide later that you no longer need or want those items, you
can often sell lvl 1 aard items for a decent chunk of what you paid for them'

Atrahasis answers 'yeah i saw that'

Atrahasis answers 'that's pretty cool :)'

Ennui answers 'To Ralyn's point, I've used my lvl 1 aard aard for 95%+ of my last 18000 levels'

Saraid answers 'I still use some of my level 1 stuff '

Ennui answers 'for 2500 qp, can't beat that.'

Ayasinda answers 'I even use some of it fot the full 201 levels'

w
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Misty Border
  The road you have been walking on has become clouded up ahead. A thick 
choking fog has descended and envelops it and you as well. The air is 
choking heavy with the moisture and a sickeningly sweet smell. You can't 
quite place your finger on it. As you turn your head to look about, you find 
that the way back has become obscured. The only things you can make out 
clearly are the road under your feet and the soft glow of the light above
you...

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

Misty Border
  The road you have been walking on has become clouded up ahead. A thick 
choking fog has descended and envelops it and you as well. The air is 
choking heavy with the moisture and a sickeningly sweet smell. You can't 
quite place your finger on it. As you turn your head to look about, you find 
that the way back has become obscured. The only things you can make out 
clearly are the road under your feet and the soft glow of the light above
you...

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

are not. In the middle of the orbs stands a man dressed in wizard clothes. 
He seems to be the one running the place.

Close to Northstar (G) [**> PK <**]
  As you appear in the middle of a field, after entering the orb, you see a
city in front of you.  You realize that it is Northstar, the capital of the
Kingdom of Northstar.  A sense of adventure and excitement fills you as you
approach the city.

Approaching the Castle (2053)

At the Gates
  As you approach the gates of the Castle, two guards greet you, saying;
"Welcome to Northstar Castle.  May your visit be good".  They move aside to
let you pass.  The sight of the castle fills your eyes with awe for the
people that live in there.  The smooth limestone blocks seem to glimmer as
the sunlight bounces off them.  

[ Exits: (north) south ]
(Golden Aura) You see a dog chasing its tail here.
(Golden Aura) A child is here playing in the street.
(Golden Aura) A foot soldier is on patrol here.

2329/2462 HP  2353/3046 MP  2052/2109 mv  874tnl  
Lv 106  G 2718035 | At the Gates (NS)
>>    In Front of the Throne Room
  The hall goes east and west from a perimeter around the main hall of the
castle.  To the north you can see the huge throne room where three thrones
are located.  The ceiling of this part reaches about twenty to thirty feet. 
Many paintings line the walls here.  You realize that the current resident
must be a person that has a great sense of art.  Among the works of art
there are suits of armor and some weapons.  This person must also be a great
warrior.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Golden Aura) A worker is working on the stained glass window here.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Golden Aura) Ruo the Elementalist is sleeping here.
(Player) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Winger Go Cubs Go! Fly the [W]!.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
(Player) (Translucent) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Isme the tired.
(Player) (Golden Aura) (Linkdead) Atrahasis the Avenger.

A Trapdoor in the Mountains
  You notice a trapdoor concealed by the mountains.  You have no idea what
would have placed this here or why; there are no tracks indicating any
presence for a very long time.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

2004/2462 HP  2161/3046 MP  2048/2109 mv  856tnl  
Lv 106  G 2719448 | A Trapdoor in the Mountains (NESW)

2004/2462 HP  2161/3046 MP  2048/2109 mv  856tnl  
Lv 106  G 2719448 | A Trapdoor in the Mountains (NESWD)
>>    Entrance to The Dungeon (G)
  A small stairway stands before you.  Screams of the tortured souls ring
out from the eerie stairway.  You ponder if you should go down or not,
wondering if the screams you hear are the souls of dead adventurers that had
intruded.  As you stand pondering, a wind blows by and sends a deep chill
down your spine; you are momentarily paralyzed, but quickly recover.  You
sense something sinister in this evil place, but you aren't sure exactly
what.  To the west, loud clanks and pounding noises ring out from a small
building.  And to the east is a quiet, medium-sized hut.  

[ Exits: (east) (west) up down ]

2029/2462 HP  2223/3046 MP  2109/2109 mv  856tnl  
Lv 106  G 2719448 | Entrance to The Dungeon ([E]WUD)
>>    Bob's Blacksmith Shop
  You walk through a thick steel door and stare in wonder at the room
before you.  Immediately, you are met by the smell smoke and sweat.  On one
wall of the shop, weapons of every type hang.  On the other side of the
shop, all sorts of armor lie, ready for use.  After going through a door at
the back of the shop, you find yourself deafened by the roar of metal being
hammered, and fires blazing as they melt steel.  Quickly, you head for the
front of the shop, and bump into a tall, well-muscled blacksmith.  With a
warm smile, he greets you and says, "Hi, my name's Bob.  Would you like to
buy something?"  

[ Exits: east ]
Bob the blacksmith stands here waiting to help you.

wondering if the screams you hear are the souls of dead adventurers that had
intruded.  As you stand pondering, a wind blows by and sends a deep chill

2029/2462 HP  2223/3046 MP  2107/2109 mv  856tnl  
Lv 106  G 2719448 | Entrance to The Dungeon (EWUD)
>>    Jen's Potion Shop
  You have entered a spotless white room.  On one side of the room is a
cute Sprite who is wearing a purple clerical robe.  She looks up and smiles
cheerfully as you walk towards her.  "You look tired, friendly adventurer,"
she says to you in a soothing tone.  She motions towards a bed in the corner
and you begin to feel very sleepy...  After a quick nap, you wake up feeling
refreshed and approach her once more.  As you notice the shelves of supplies
behind her, she asks, "Would you care to buy something to aid you on your
journeys?"  

[ Exits: west ]

2029/2462 HP  2223/3046 MP  2105/2109 mv  856tnl  
Lv 106  G 2719448 | Entrance to The Dungeon (EWUD)
>>    Bob's Blacksmith Shop
  You walk through a thick steel door and stare in wonder at the room
before you.  Immediately, you are met by the smell smoke and sweat.  On one
wall of the shop, weapons of every type hang.  On the other side of the
shop, all sorts of armor lie, ready for use.  After going through a door at
the back of the shop, you find yourself deafened by the roar of metal being
hammered, and fires blazing as they melt steel.  Quickly, you head for the
front of the shop, and bump into a tall, well-muscled blacksmith.  With a
warm smile, he greets you and says, "Hi, my name's Bob.  Would you like to
buy something?"  

[ Exits: east ]
Bob the blacksmith stands here waiting to help you.

Lv 106  G 2719448 | Bob's Blacksmith Shop (E)

e
d
Entrance to The Dungeon (G)
  A small stairway stands before you.  Screams of the tortured souls ring
out from the eerie stairway.  You ponder if you should go down or not,
wondering if the screams you hear are the souls of dead adventurers that had
intruded.  As you stand pondering, a wind blows by and sends a deep chill
down your spine; you are momentarily paralyzed, but quickly recover.  You
sense something sinister in this evil place, but you aren't sure exactly
what.  To the west, loud clanks and pounding noises ring out from a small
building.  And to the east is a quiet, medium-sized hut.  

[ Exits: east west up down ]

>>    WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Golden Aura) Ruo the Elementalist.
(Player) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Winger Go Cubs Go! Fly the [W]!.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

Room of Facts
  You stand in a room like many of the other and you see comfortable benches
placed along the many placard stands.  Your head is spinning as you try to
decide whether you want to prop up your feet and rest, or attempt to absorb
even more facts.  Your weary mind resists the latter, as this has been a day
like no other from the second you entered the museum, which is like no
other.

*The Lighthouse stands on the island of Pharaohs. 
*The Lighthouse stood over 400 feet tall. 
*There were six wonders to disappear and the Lighthouse was one of them. 
*It is the seventh wonder added to the list. 
*The lighthouse helped ships up to 25 miles away.

>>    The Statue of Zeus (2097)

Room of Facts
  You walk into a large room with placards placed along the walls.  You see
etchings, a case filled with small bits of stone, miniature statues.  You
walk up closer and read one of the placards.  Wonder Fact: In Greek
mythology Zeus was the god of the sky.  He was the rain god, a cloud
gatherer.  He wields a mighty thunderbolt.  He is represented as the god of
justice and mercy, protector of the weak, punisher of the evil.  He was
married to Hera who was also his sister and was father to many children. 
His son Ares was god of war, Hebe the goddess of youth, Hephaestus the god
of fire, and Eilethyia the goddess of childbirth.  

[ Exits: north ]

  On his head is a sculpted wreath of olive sprays, in his right hand he
holds a figure of Victory made from ivory and gold...  In his left hand, he
holds a sceptre inlaid with every kind of metal, with an eagle perched on
the sceptre.  His sandals are made of gold, as is his robe.  His garments
are carved with the animals and with lilies.  The throne is decorated with
gold, precious stones, ebony, and ivory.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Within the Dark Forest
  You suddenly find yourself in a different part of the forest.  It is a
lot darker and quieter here, even the trees seem wider and more foreboding. 
Everything has strange feel to it, from the small pebble that you just
stepped on to some rustling branches that startled you.  You feel an eerie
sense of having stumbled upon an unmapped sector of the forest.  A faint
murmur catches your attention, it seemed to come from the north.  Looking
closely you notice a small path has now revealed itself.  You follow it
cautiously, keeping a close eye on your surroundings.  Your heart begins to
beat faster and faster as you approach the end and discover a well hidden
cave.  You are scared yet incredibly curious as to what's inside, and decide
to continue on slowly..  

[ Exits: north up ]

A Small Clearing
  Stepping out of the bushes, you find yourself in a less dense part of the
forest.  Beams of light from the sky shine down creating leafy patterns over
the ground.  Animals roam peacefully, searching for food and enjoying the
sun.  You feel relieved to be away from the constant fighting, but the
occaisional sound of a muffled scream ahead makes you wonder if even these
tranquil surroundings are safe.

Stone Avenue (2095)

Stone Avenue (2094)

Castle Gates
  You get the perfect opportunity to admire the beauty of the Citadel as
you stand at the gates.  The walls are built of many different stones and
gems, creating a glorious pattern across the surface.  The citadel seems to
glow as the sun shines and glints on the polished surface.  You cannot even
imagine how much time it must have taken to build such an amazing building. 
Before coming to the Stone City you had heard many stories of the Citadel's
beauty, but still you did not expect to find a building as magical and
enchanting as this.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

>>    Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

219/2462 HP  851/3046 MP  2108/2109 mv  212tnl  
Lv 106  G 2737138 | Boot Clan Public Hall (NESW)
w
>>    Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

>>    Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

e
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Within the Dark Forest
  You suddenly find yourself in a different part of the forest.  It is a
lot darker and quieter here, even the trees seem wider and more foreboding. 
Everything has strange feel to it, from the small pebble that you just
stepped on to some rustling branches that startled you.  You feel an eerie
sense of having stumbled upon an unmapped sector of the forest.  A faint
murmur catches your attention, it seemed to come from the north.  Looking
closely you notice a small path has now revealed itself.  You follow it
cautiously, keeping a close eye on your surroundings.  Your heart begins to
beat faster and faster as you approach the end and discover a well hidden
cave.  You are scared yet incredibly curious as to what's inside, and decide
to continue on slowly..  

[ Exits: north up ]

help fire breath
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Fire Breath'.
Help Category : Attack Spell.
Related Helps :  Acid Wave, Ice Cloud, Shock Aura, Toxic Cloud.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-18 21:31:04.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: cast 'fire breath'
Damage: fire
Spell Number: 84

This spell damages all victims in the room.
The caster breathes fire like a dragon. In addition to doing damage, fire
breath can also cause blindness, destroy water, burn equipment and increase
thirst.

Primary stat: Intelligence.
Affected by : Luck.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Ascension Bluff (2117)

A Somber Walkway (G)
  After ascending a stairway of clouds leading into the heavens, an individual 
would probably expect to find something surreal at the top. Many an explorer 
has been left disappointed, however, since this is nothing more than the 
Ascension Bluff Nursing Home. The architect thought that a stairway of clouds
would make the residents feel closer to the gods. Unfortunately, all this 
served to do was make this location less suitable for visitors and employees 
to frequent. Further to this, when one closely inspects the clouds, they will
come to the realization that they are not real clouds at all, but rather 
millions of tiny cotton balls affixed to a steel frame. Interestingly enough,
it seems that a nursing home in the clouds acquires quite the eclectic bunch 
of residents. Anyone who chances by a for a visit will find that this nursing
home contains more than just your ordinary sampling of senior citizens.

A Somber Walkway (2116)

A Somber Walkway (2116)

Entrance to Ascension Bluff
  At the entrance to the Ascension Bluff Nursing home the pathway widens into a
semi-circle of flagstones that are surrounded by several stout wooden 
benches. A low-set stone wall hugs all of these particulars, and three wide, 
curved steps lead up to the front entrance of the nursing home. This nursing 
home has been made to look like a lodge in hopes that the residents will feel
like they are simply here on vacation. The roof has a steep slope and the 
exterior of the building has been carefully crafted from wooden logs. Patio 
doors lead straight out to the front gardens and walkway from many locations 
along the front of the building. Even more light is brought into the nursing 
home via expansive, arched windows that take up much of the wall-space above
the patio doors.

[ Exits: (north) south ]
     (Magic) A stout wooden bench is here to relax on.
A witch is here, snooping around for spell components.
(Red Aura) This carnivorous plant is ready to chomp some flesh!
This visitor seems antsy and is engaged in some mindless pacing.
(Red Aura) A little owl is resting on its perch.

>>    The Reception Area (2116)

A dementia fairy grins mischievously at you.
The Reception Area
  Here is a bar where visitors can serve themselves tea or a cup of coffee (of 
the decaffeinated variety, unfortunately). There is no one here to serve the 
drinks, but a fundraising jar has been placed on the bar so that those who 
partake in a beverage can place a gold coin inside. To the west and south are
rooms that house nursing home residents. Each door has had its occupant's 
name magically engraved upon it.

[ Exits: north east (south) (west) ]
(Golden Aura) Here is a courier who looks a bit stressed.
A refreshment bar stands here like an oasis.

2426/2496 HP  2494/3079 MP  2115/2128 mv  980tnl  
Lv 107  G 2811627 | The Reception Area (NE[S][W])
>>    You open the door.

2426/2496 HP  2494/3079 MP  2115/2128 mv  980tnl  
Lv 107  G 2811627 | The Reception Area (NES[W])
>>    Harold's Room
  Big Harold's room is quite simple and masculine. He has brought in a large 
black leather armchair and couch for the sitting area, and a coffee table 
stands between them. The coffee table has many drawers in it, so it's quite 
possible he is hiding some of his favorite tasty snacks in there! Harold 
definitely has a love for all foods that are sweet. Every resident gets a 
basic room that comes with a bed supplied by the nursing home. They are 
encouraged to furnish the room further in order to add their own personal 
touch. Each resident room has tongue and groove boards an inch thick, 
installed vertically for the walls, and thicker boards for the floor and 
roof.

[ Exits: north (west) ]
     (Magic) Who will eat this plum pudding?
     (Magic) This nursing home bed does not look especially comfortable.
(Translucent) (Golden Aura) Big Harold is eating some cookies he stole from Glaadys.

2426/2496 HP  2494/3079 MP  2114/2128 mv  980tnl  
Lv 107  G 2811627 | Harold's Room (NW)
>>    Big Harold's Bathroom
  It is nice and warm in here. This is mainly because the room is heated by a 
series of pipes that pump hot water through it, but also because there is a 
bathtub in the corner that is filled with hot bath water. One of the reasons 
that this nursing home has such a great reputation is due to its modern way 
of utilizing a plumbing system in order to provide fresh water for the 
patients. The other residents share a common bathing chamber, but Harold was 
given a special bath all of his own since hydrotherapy was deemed a necessity
in order to help treat his arthritic pains.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

The Goat Skull Gate (G) [**> PK <**]
  There is a large iron gate here, with a short elf guarding it.  The gate
is going north into a mountain. There appears to be a cave north of here,
but you can't see through the gate very well.  There are many different
rocks embedded in the mountain.  It almost seems that they form a pattern.
You can hear the dripping of water from inside the caves.
There is also a cold draft of air hitting you.  Perhaps this is the
entrance to the legendary Dark Elf Fortress?

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Nightlands of Kherashin (2088)

The Pass
  At the southwestern edge of the Halo Mountains lies the entrance to Dusk 
Valley.  The pass is fifteen feet wide and half a mile long.  Cliffs on both 
sides shoot up hundreds of feet.  The wind at the entrance of the pass screams 
through.  Small boulders and rocks continuously fall from above and explode 
upon impacting the ground.  The ground is made up of rock, dust, sand, and 
crushed up bones.  Near the end the pass where the cliffs end the ground 
transitions to a rich farmable soil.  

[ Exits: north south ]
A nightwalker stands at ease.

n
Into the Dusk
  The cliffs of the Halo Mountains suddenly end at the edge of Dusk Valley.  
Stories tell of ancient arcane battles within these lands.  The rich, farmable 
soil along the road is damp and contains many varieties of bones from many 
different animals and races.  There is a fine steamy mist throughout the valley 
that dims out the sun during the day.  Shadows move about the mist and there 
are low moans in the distance.  The main road that runs north and south 
through the valley is perfectly constructed with glowing slate in an archaic 
printbone pattern.  Along the outside of the road many radiant globes float 
motionless above. 

[ Exits: north south ]
(Golden Aura) A Relyk harmer counts his victories.

1819/2496 HP  2250/3079 MP  2125/2128 mv  640tnl  
Lv 107  G 2817897 | Into the Dusk (NS)
>>    The Crepuscular
  The archaic printbone pattern in the glowing slate road ends abruptly.  A 
complex radial brick pattern outlines the southeast border of the large town 
square.  The bricks are made of some type of sandstone and give off a very 
different aura.  The atmosphere closely resembles a solar eclipse.  Numerous 
varieties of plants are able to grow in the valley due to the partial sunlight 
and the moist, rich soil.  Spherical objects magically appear and disappear 
through the steamy mist.  Cloaked Eldars move about on and off the road.  Their 
faces are hidden and unrecognizable except for their eyes and most of them 
carry staves made of bones.

[ Exits: north south west ]
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) A piece of sandstone lies here.
An Eldar farmer shuffles his feet.
A mist demon blends into a light mist.

w
Half-Light
  The southwestern edge of the town square is defined by the radial pattern 
of sandstone bricks that are carefully embedded into the ground.  Winged
creatures hover overhead and their bodies appear distorted.  The light from 
the sun amounts to about half of its potential due to the haze.  Cloaked 
Eldars with fixed eyes are busy buying and selling items while they rapidly 
move in and out of the mist.  The ancient Eldar language they speak drones on 
like a chant. 

[ Exits: north east west ]
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) A farmer's pitchfork looks sharp.
(Golden Aura) A Relyk scout studies footprints and tracks on the ground.
An Eldar citizen wants to protect his lands.

1819/2496 HP  2250/3079 MP  2124/2128 mv  640tnl  
Lv 107  G 2817897 | Half-Light (NEW)
>>    The Grindstone
  The Grindstone has a stone foundation that supports the wooden walls and 
ceiling.  The stones have been brought into town from the cliffs of Halo 
Mountains, and the lumber from the forestry in the valley.  The blacksmith 
has built all of his own tools and weapons by hand.  A blaze burns in the 
blacksmith's forge near the rear of the building.  A large anvil sits on 
a pillar next to the forge, and a hammer lies on top.  Metal chains hang 
from rafters up above.  A tub of water is near the door that contains silver, 
iron, gold, and copper.

[ Exits: east ]
Cinder the assistant stands close to the forge.
Ashan Coldstone beams a warm smile and welcomes you to the shop.

>>    Eventide
  The sandstone brick pattern outlines the northeast border of the town 
square.  There are no visible shops through the mist but the cloaked Eldars
trade objects and materials inconspicuously in small groups.  The figures 
constantly mumble a strange language under their breaths.  Some of the cloaked 
figures sell exquisite lockboxes that are decorated with all types of rubies 
and other gems.  The buyers and sellers appear to complete their sales and then 
quickly step back into the anonymity provided by the mist.

>>    
Shades of Silence
  Through the haze is the northwest boundary of the town square.  The sandstone 
bricks provide much needed light and intensive heat radiates upwards.  Cloaked 
Eldars rush by in a hurry to buy and sell goods.  Gold coins occasionally fall 
on the ground but are quickly snatched up.  Strange livestock strolls through 
the town square and fades into the mist.  A peculiar shadow is cast from no 
apparent object; the Eldars do not speak here.

[ Exits: north east south ]
     The moon's shadow lies here.
A lonely woman cries for her loss.

Eventide
  The sandstone brick pattern outlines the northeast border of the town 
square.  There are no visible shops through the mist but the cloaked Eldars
trade objects and materials inconspicuously in small groups.  The figures 
constantly mumble a strange language under their breaths.  Some of the cloaked 
figures sell exquisite lockboxes that are decorated with all types of rubies 
and other gems.  The buyers and sellers appear to complete their sales and then 
quickly step back into the anonymity provided by the mist.

>>    The Bleak

found on both sides of the road.  There is a massive temperature drop here
and very little vegetation.  A strong wind rushes from the east, bringing in
additional dust.  Cloaked Eldars quickly walk by.

>>    Beyond the Verge [**> PK <**]
  A strange fault rises slightly out of the ground and crosses the road.  
It has been on the road for some time and has partially eroded away.  The 
south side of the fault line is brisk and cold, but immediately on the 
north side it is unbearably hot.  A light mist in the valley is present only 
on the north side of the fault line.  The wind has died down to a gentle 
breeze.  The dirt road makes a sharp turn east in the vegetation.

In The Grip
  A massive energy is at work, pulling everything towards a stone obelisk.  
Large boulders, vegetation, animals, and anything else not embedded into the 
ground gets sucked up.  All objects that make contact with the obelisk are 
immediately crushed down into bits.  The strange force constantly rumbles and 
makes the ground shake.  Large faults have opened up where the road used to be.
Dust storms come from every direction and carry with them a very fine, gritty 
sand.  Most light from above is snuffed out from the dust storms, but the 
obelisk shines brilliantly.

The Dread
  Northwest of the town square, the glowing slate road begins again.  Each 
piece of slate has been perfectly set into place and the design of the stones 
is the traditional archaic Eldar printbone pattern.  The aura of the glowing 
stones provides the only light.  The haze is so thick that you lose all depth 
perception.  Shadows and figures run by on all sides but no distinct figures 
can be made out.  The sound of large wings comes from above.

The Vallum and the Bind
  The store is literally piled to the ceiling with scrolls and books.  The 
walls are completely lined with shelves and every nook and cranny has been 
filled.  Every type of goatskin, parchment, manuscript, and anything else 
that can be written on might be found here.  The store is mostly a library, 
so only a few items are for sale.  A wide desk sits in the center of the room 
with a stack of rolled-up scrolls on it.  Next to the scrolls is a collection 
of different seals and candles.  The room smells of ink, preserved animal 
skins, and pipe smoke.

The Pull
  
The dirt road runs north and east. A strong energy pulls everything toward
the east. Giant boulders roll across the road. Vegetation is sucked out of 
the ground and a dust storm is created from the materials of the dirt road.
Light from the sky is dimmed from the amount of debris in the atmosphere 
caused by the energy.

[ Exits: north east ]
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) A silver mace is here.
(Golden Aura) A strong Eldar citizen stands at ease.

2035/2496 HP  2048/3079 MP  2128/2128 mv  378tnl  
Lv 107  G 2825214 | The Pull (NE)
>>    Last Phase
  The strength of the energy from the south east is very weak here and 
hardly any of the vegetation on the sides of the road has been yanked out 
of the ground.  The energy from the southeast sucks only a minimal amount 
of debris into the air in this area.  The light in the atmosphere has a 
unique twilight effect, a combination of the light produced at dusk and 
dawn.

[ Exits: north south ]
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) A silver mace is here.
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) A crow talon is here.

n
The West Crossroads
  The West Crossroads unites the road extending south, east, and west.  A
strange energy from the south produces a gentle pull.  Further to the 
southeast is a large dust storm that rises high in the atmosphere.  The 
Bridge of Bones lies directly to the east.  The western road leads to 
a large number of tall buildings and structures.  The crossroad is nothing 
more than dirt, sand, and small bits of rocks.  

[ Exits: east south west ]

2035/2496 HP  2048/3079 MP  2128/2128 mv  378tnl  
Lv 107  G 2825214 | The West Crossroads (ESW)
>>    
e
n
Bridge of Bones
  The road from the east ends at the entrance to the Bridge of Bones.  
The cliffs give way to a bottomless pit.  Big chunks of rock crumble at 
the edge of the cliff and fall into the hole.  Multiple ropes pulled taut 
by steel hooks in the ground hold each beam in place.  The walkway is 
made entirely from rope and bones.  Each bone is wrapped tightly with
ropes to hold it in place.  The bridge continues for miles. 

[ Exits: north west ]
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) A dagger of corrupted steel is here.
(Invis) (Hidden) (Red Aura) An Eldar assassin stands ready for anything.
(Red Aura) An apprentice sorcerer prepares for war.
(Red Aura) An apprentice navigator stands motionless and stares.
(Golden Aura) An Eldar cleric tries to determine your next move.

2035/2496 HP  2048/3079 MP  2128/2128 mv  378tnl  
Lv 107  G 2825214 | Bridge of Bones (NW)
n
>>    The Swing
  The Bridge of Bones runs north and south and each step that you take
swings the bridge side to side.  The hand grips made of rope are meant to 
help provide tension and to keep the traveler safe.  Almost all of the bones 
along the walkway are still in place.  Occasionally a bone breaks free and 
falls into the bottomless pit.  Sounds of crumbling and breaking rocks come 
from the cliffs to the south. North from here, the bridge turns toward the 
east.

[ Exits: north south ]
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) A heavy hammer lies here.
     A Relyk armband lies here.
     A bone lies here.

>>    The Twist
  The center of the bridge turns gradually and runs south and east.  Many 
ropes along the southeast side of the bridge have become frayed and broken.  
The lack of tension has caused this entire section of the bridge to twist 
almost completely on its side.  The handrails have to be used just to 
proceed in either direction.

from age.  Many of the rope fibers have strange algae growing on them.

A Wide Gap
  The bridge makes a gradual turn and runs south and west.  Most of the long 
ropes are still intact but a large number of bones have completely come loose 
and fallen down into the hole.  There is very little to walk on except for a 
few tiny bones attached to thin pieces of rope.  Some of the shorter pieces 
of rope hang down below the bridge gripping large pieces of bone.  The bones 
blow up sideways from the fierce winds.

The East Crossroads [**> PK <**]
  The East Crossroads unites the road extending to the south, east, and west.  
The Bridge of Bones lies directly to the west.  Further to the northeast 
stand many buildings and structures.  The crossroad is nothing more than dirt, 
sand, and small bits of rocks.  The valley mist is thick and blocks out most 
light.  Directly above the center of the crossroads are a large amount of 
radiant globes that shine down on the road. 

[ Exits: east south west ]

2059/2496 HP  2096/3079 MP  2125/2128 mv  378tnl

  There is a large break in the mist and green fields can be seen for miles.  
Wildlife moves about in search for food and shelter.  The dim atmosphere 
found in the rest of the valley does not exist here.  The air is full of 
insects and birds.

s
[**> PK <**] >>    Through the Austere
  The wide dirt road runs north and south.  Heat radiates from the ground 
and carries with it the muggy valley mist.  Birds fly around in an aggressive 
manner chasing insects.  Wispy clouds fill the sky and block out the majority 
of light.  Radiant globes float above the edges of the road and light the 
walkway.  Vegetation in the fields has turned brown due to lack of sunlight 
but crops still bear fruit and flowers blossom.

[ Exits: north south ]
(Golden Aura) A strong Eldar citizen stands at ease.

2059/2496 HP  2096/3079 MP  2125/2128 mv  378tnl  
Lv 107  G 2825214 | Through the Austere (NS)
>>    
Somber Sights
  The dirt road widens from about twelve feet to one hundred feet.  This
passage is wide enough for a large army to pass through without having to
leave the road.  The air is very still and a large variety of bird calls
come from all directions.  Very little of the valley mist is present. 
Along the outside of the road many radiant globes float motionless 
above, providing much needed light.

[ Exits: north south ]

The Pitch
  The dirt road splits off toward the north, south and east.  A strange energy
sucks up debris and carries it westward.  Some of the ground has been pulled
away leaving behind a shallow pitch in the terrain, although most of the road
is intact.  Vegetation has been uprooted from the fields and you notice small
rocks fly by heading west.

  The dirt road runs east and west.  An very strong energy pulls objects to 
the west.  Much of the ground has been pulled up, leaving behind a steep 
downward slope in the terrain.  A massive dust storm to the west rises high 
in the atmosphere, blocking out light.  No insects can be found as they have 
been sucked away.

>>    The Hook (G)
  The dirt road splits north, east, and west.  An incredibly strong
energy pulls everything to the west.  Rocks and boulders roll across 
the road heading west.  Vegetation is ripped from the ground and joins 
the debris of the road to create a dust storm that dims the light from

2059/2496 HP  2096/3079 MP  2125/2128 mv  378tnl  
Lv 107  G 2825214 | The Hook (NEW)
n
>>    
The Golden Egg
  The lobby of The Golden Egg is known for its comfort and hospitality.  The
Golden Egg stands as the only inn throughout the entire Dusk Valley.  The
room is filled with vibrant colors from floor to ceiling.  Famous Eldar
leaders are immortalized in paintings that hang on the wall just above
handsome inscriptions bearing their names.  The frames of the portraits 
are handcrafted and decorated with gold inlay.  Leather couches and
recliners are arranged around a fireplace on the west wall near a small
library.  A display table has been set up with a full buffet in the
southwest corner.  The owner stands behind the check-in counter which also
happens to be a full bar.  You can just see the owner's eyes within the
hood of his cloak.  Tall leather bar stools line the entire bar.  A large
variety of bottled beverages are neatly placed on shelves behind the
counter.   

[ Exits: east south ]
The innkeeper's servant keeps hard at work.
The innkeeper welcomes you to The Golden Egg.
The innkeeper's son mimics his father's movements.
The innkeeper says, 'Someone needs to take control of The Great Totem.'
The innkeeper says, 'If you think you can, say 'yes'.'

2059/2496 HP  2096/3079 MP  2125/2128 mv  378tnl  
Lv 107  G 2825214 | The Golden Egg (ES)
e
>>    The Blue Room
  The Blue Room is designed to hold a small army.  Rows of bunk beds
stacked ten high fill the room.  Sturdy wooden ladders stretch all the way
to the top beds of each column of bunks.  The pillows and blankets have
been neatly made up.  Tall closets run along the perimeter of the room. 
Windows line the northern, southern and eastern walls.  A strong dust
storm that even carries large objects blows outside the southern windows. 

[ Exits: west ]

>>    The Cleansing
  A giant hole filled with water is the only way across the land here.  
Black scorch marks around the edge of the hole indicate that Eldar magicks 
were used to blast the dirt out of the ground.  This pool resembles a moat 
and large shadows of creatures can be seen directly under the surface of the 
water.  The water is riddled with thin logs that act as walkways.  Bones, 
remains, and clothing litter the entire pool.

[ Exits: north east west ]

stacked on top.  A respectable library of many books on light spells and 
Eldar history is in the northeast corner.  Stone steps continue all the way 
up to the peak of the tower.

manner chasing insects.  Wispy clouds fill the sky and block out the majority 
of light.  Radiant globes float above the edges of the road and light the 
walkway.  Vegetation in the fields has turned brown due to lack of sunlight 
but crops still bear fruit and flowers blossom.

[ Exits: north south ]
(Golden Aura) A strong Eldar citizen stands at ease.

The East Crossroads [**> PK <**]
  The East Crossroads unites the road extending to the south, east, and west.  
The Bridge of Bones lies directly to the west.  Further to the northeast 
stand many buildings and structures.  The crossroad is nothing more than dirt, 
sand, and small bits of rocks.  The valley mist is thick and blocks out most 
light.  Directly above the center of the crossroads are a large amount of 
radiant globes that shine down on the road. 

[ Exits: east south west ]

2059/2496 HP  2096/3079 MP  2119/2128 mv  378tnl  
Lv 107  G 2825214 | The East Crossroads (ESW)
w
[**> PK <**] >>    Bridge of Bones
  The road from the east ends at the entrance to the Bridge of Bones.  
The cliffs give way to a bottomless pit.  Big chunks of rock crumble at 
the edge of the cliff and fall into the hole.  Multiple ropes pulled taut 
by steel hooks in the ground hold each beam in place.  The walkway is 
made entirely from rope and bones.  Each bone is wrapped tightly with
ropes to hold it in place.  The bridge continues for miles. 

[ Exits: north east ]

>>    A Wide Gap
  The bridge makes a gradual turn and runs south and west.  Most of the long 
ropes are still intact but a large number of bones have completely come loose 
and fallen down into the hole.  There is very little to walk on except for a 
few tiny bones attached to thin pieces of rope.  Some of the shorter pieces 
of rope hang down below the bridge gripping large pieces of bone.  The bones 
blow up sideways from the fierce winds.

Into the Clear [**> PK <**]
  The well-used dirt road travels east and west, and grassy fields lie to 
the north and south.  The road has been widened to provide a walkway for an 
army.  The layers of dust cover the road and leave deep footprints.  
Cloaked Eldars pass by continuously in groups and speak the ancient Eldar 
dialect.  Light is very good here even at night.  There is no valley mist 
or haze, and the humidity is minimal.  The baggy cloaks worn by the Eldars 
are kept on their bodies by leather belts and straps.  Coin bags hang from 
their waist, and most of the Eldars carry tall staves designed from bones.  
Somehow the bones have been wrapped around each other to make a single staff.  

[ Exits: east west ]
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) A dagger of corrupted steel is here.
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) A farmer's pitchfork looks sharp.
(Red Aura) An apprentice sorcerer prepares for war.
(Red Aura) A master navigator eyes your moves and stands fast.
(Golden Aura) An Eldar cleric tries to determine your next move.

[**> PK <**] >>    Before the Threshold
  The road intersects north, south and east.  A large totem stands to the 
south, and clear skies to the east.  Many buildings occupy the north and 
a magick threshold stands between the road and the buildings.  The aura 
produced by the threshold gives off a warm vibration and faintly hums.  The 
ground gently shakes and rattles.

>>    
The Great Totem
  A enormous totem stands in the middle of this green field.  It is three 
feet wide and two hundred feet tall.  A platform of bricks laid out in the
traditional archaic Eldar printbone pattern is set at the base of the
totem.  The totem is constructed from solid oak lumber.  Each individual 
layer of the totem glows with a unique color and represents a separate 
animal.

[ Exits: north other ]
(Red Aura) An Eldar farmer kicks the dust off his boots.

>>    The Pool
  A giant hole filled with water is the only way across the land here.  
Black scorch marks around the edge of the hole indicate that Eldar magicks 
were used to blast the dirt out of the ground.  This pool resembles a moat 
and large shadows of creatures can be seen directly under the surface of the 
water.  The water is riddled with thin logs that act as walkways.  Bones, 
remains, and clothing litter the entire pool.

>>    The Western Tower
  The four exterior walls of the Western Tower are constructed with marble 
blocks.  The interior is vivid and bright.  Colorful fabrics line the interior 
walls, magnificent furniture can be found everywhere, and an oak hardwood
floor covers the ground.  A large desk sits in the middle of the room with many 
drawers and compartments.  An enormous library of scrolls and books on dark 
magick and Eldar history is on the western wall.  Stone steps climb up to the peak 
of the tower.

>>    WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Golden Aura) Ruo the Elementalist.

A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Entry Foyer
  This room has a pleasant, clean atmosphere.  The carpet is lush and
thick, soothing to weary feet.  Once, perfect nature murals covered the
walls, but now they are singed in spots and their beauty is marred.  Flowers
are dotted about the room, preserved by the unconquerable magic deep within
the foundations...

End of the Beautiful Hallway
  This part of the hallway continues to be just as majestically decorated
as the rest.  At first, it seems that the tunnel here was dug entirely out
of soft dirt...  But looking more closely, you see that it is in fact only
painted that way.  There are doors north and south, leading to even more
occupancy rooms.  The hallway goes back west, and to the east is a thick
wooden door.

>>    High-Security Area
  This area is very secure.  To the east, south, and north are solid wooden
doors with one tiny, barred window in each.  Beside the western door to the
hallway is a seat carved into the stone: no doubt a place of rest for the
Nispeung on duty, but a thin layer of dust rests on it, betraying the fact
that it has not been used in some time.

>>    Boarders' Apartments
  This room is comfortably large.  To either side of the doorway is a
double-high capacious bed, piled high with colorful blankets and pillows. 
The head of each is a wooden cabinet space, carved in scenes of feasts and
festivals.  A window lets in natural light, and the comforting magic light
present everywhere else is stronger here, seeming to have healing and
regenerating properties...  The door through which you entered is the only
way out.

>>    Beautiful Hallway
  Here, the hallway is even more pleasant and welcoming...  If that's even
at all possible.  The ever-present carpet is just as comfortable and
luxuriant as always, and the walls are painted a deep, rich green that
overwhelms you with its resemblance to forests and grasslands.  West, an
immense, beautifully carved wooden door blocks your view.  The hallway just
keeps going to the east, eventually ending at another majestic door there. 
You see simple doors to the north and south, leading to the patients'
uniformly commodious quarters.

>>    The Great Magician's Study
  Across from the door of this room is a large wooden desk.  To the far
right, the wall is completely covered in bookcases containing parchments,
great magicians' writings, scribbled notes, and many studies in magic. 
Evidence of study is everywhere: shelves and tables hold vials with
nasty-looking potions in them, unmade wands, and other magical items.

>>    End of the Beautiful Hallway
  This part of the hallway continues to be just as majestically decorated
as the rest.  At first, it seems that the tunnel here was dug entirely out
of soft dirt...  But looking more closely, you see that it is in fact only
painted that way.  There are doors north and south, leading to even more
occupancy rooms.  The hallway goes back west, and to the east is a thick
wooden door.

>>    High-Security Area
  This area is very secure.  To the east, south, and north are solid wooden
doors with one tiny, barred window in each.  Beside the western door to the
hallway is a seat carved into the stone: no doubt a place of rest for the
Nispeung on duty, but a thin layer of dust rests on it, betraying the fact
that it has not been used in some time.

that it has not been used in some time.

High-Security Area
  This area is very secure.  To the east, south, and north are solid wooden
doors with one tiny, barred window in each.  Beside the western door to the
hallway is a seat carved into the stone: no doubt a place of rest for the
Nispeung on duty, but a thin layer of dust rests on it, betraying the fact
that it has not been used in some time.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

Approaching the Castle (2135)

At the Gates
  As you approach the gates of the Castle, two guards greet you, saying;
"Welcome to Northstar Castle.  May your visit be good".  They move aside to
let you pass.  The sight of the castle fills your eyes with awe for the
people that live in there.  The smooth limestone blocks seem to glimmer as
the sunlight bounces off them.  

[ Exits: (north) south ]
(Golden Aura) (White Aura) A knight with Northstar armor on stands here, protecting the city.

2132/2534 HP  927/3110 MP  2134/2146 mv  636tnl  
Lv 108  G 2866657 | At the Gates (NS)
>>    *[NOEXP]* In Front of the Throne Room
  The hall goes east and west from a perimeter around the main hall of the
castle.  To the north you can see the huge throne room where three thrones
are located.  The ceiling of this part reaches about twenty to thirty feet. 
Many paintings line the walls here.  You realize that the current resident
must be a person that has a great sense of art.  Among the works of art
there are suits of armor and some weapons.  This person must also be a great
warrior.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

the far wall.  Above the middle throne, which is slightly larger then the

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
The Throne Room
  You finally reach the end of the hall and you see that only one of the
three thrones is being used.  You realize that you are in front of the Queen
of Northstar.  You quickly bow to give the proper respect to her.  You look up
and see many workers cleaning a large stain glass window above the queen. 
To the east and west you see hallways leading to other places in the castle.
Perhaps one of them will go to Elena's room.  Standing next to the queen is
Devlin, the queen's bodyguard.  He has sworn to protect her and her family
to the death.  

[ Exits: east south west up ]

must be a person that has a great sense of art.  Among the works of art
there are suits of armor and some weapons.  This person must also be a great
warrior.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Cardo Maximus
  As you enter the city gates, you notice some of the beauty and luxury
Pompeii offers.  Under your feet, the street is paved with smooth limestone,
and elaborately constructed buildings are all around.  To the west, you see
a sign on a door.  To the north, the city waits to be explored.  Bronze
oil lanterns in each doorway light the street and allow the spectacular
murals on the walls to be seen.
